utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, HOST
utterances.utterance: Hello, everybody. I'm Jesse Watters along with Jedediah Bila, Juan Williams, Dana Perino, and Greg. It's 5 o'clock in New York City, and that's Greg and The Five. Fox News alert, President Trump blasting Speaker Nancy Pelosi just moments ago for canceling the State of the Union he was planning to deliver in the House chamber on Tuesday.

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP
utterances.utterance: The State of the Union speech has been canceled by Nancy Pelosi because she doesn't want to hear the truth. She doesn't want the American public to hear what's going on. And she's afraid of the truth. We were planning on doing a really very important speech in front of the House and the Senate and the Supreme Court. So, we just found out that she's canceled it I think that's a great blotch on the incredible country that we all love. But she blames security, but she knew it wasn't a security problem. I just got back from Iraq. I was very safe in Iraq, and I felt very safe. We had great, great security. If we can handle Iraq, we can handle the middle of Washington. We'll do something in the alternative. We'll be talking to you about that at a later date. But what she's doing to the American people, what she's doing to our constitution is a disgrace.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What was that movie, Greg? You can't handle the truth.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.utterance: Yes, Jerry Maguire.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm kidding. I know. I'm joking. Are you asking me a question?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, I'm just teeing you up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm ecstatic -- you know, I'm ecstatic, this is all coming together. I didn't want to go to D.C. D.C. is like the worst ride in America's amusement park. There's no fun in D.C., just walking tours, walking tours. It's the most overrated capital in America, and I include Sacramento in that. This is another thing. Thank you, Donald Trump, that he has disrupted and gotten off our plate. Last year was the Correspondents' Dinner. We didn't need that. We don't miss it. We're not going to miss the State of the Union. He should do it sky writing. That's my -- he should sky write his State of the Union or he should do it in a twitter thread. That's easy too. But you don't need this stupid pomp and -- pomp and --

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, HOST
utterances.utterance: Circumstance?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- circumstance? Thank you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What would the sky writing say? Build the wall and crime will fall?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, exactly, and then we're done. But he's gotten rid -- gotten rid of Correspondence Dinner, State of the Union, I think he should get rid of stubborn belly fat and embarrassing back fat. Those diarrhea pills that come in a little pods that you can't open, get rid of that. TMV, get rid of that. We're done.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What is TMV?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: DMV.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: DMV.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: TMZ.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK. Don't get rid of TMZ. We love you, Harvey. So, this is a big blotch.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: This has never happened before and he's checked it out, and I don't know if it has. He's saying that he was safe in Iraq when he went during the shutdown, why can't D.C. be just as safe?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, I've always though that Nancy Pelosi had a stronger argument saying we're not doing the State of the Union until the government is back open. But you and all work on a date from when the government is back open we'll invite you down, and she's still kind of saying that. But her first -- well, her first letter said please come, give a State of the Union on January 29. The second one said, I think it would not be a good idea because of security concerns. And he's right, like that was lame. The security concerns are not real. I think she would be even stronger at that point to be able to say, no, we're not doing this until the government is reopened. These people deserve to be paid for the work they're doing. So, when that's done, you can come back.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And he -- she sent the first letter during the shutdown, Juan, so the president is saying why are using this as an excuse when you invited me during the shutdown in the beginning?

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, HOST
utterances.utterance: Well, I don't buy the security thing at all. But, I mean, clearly, what's going on here is the government is not functioning. There're real issues at play. I mean, you stop and look at it, it's not only the -- I think it's 800,000 not being paid, the contractors. Today, we heard about IRS agents who are not reporting but getting passes so they can go out and get, you know, small jobs to help pay the bills. FBI says child trafficking, terror investigations are being impeded, according to the FBI union. The airports, we know about. The coast guard we know about. You know, to me, this is a real problem. Even the State Department says they're going to have a conference on border security, they can't have that. So -- I mean, this is -- you know, Senator Mark Warner said stop stupidity, stop inflicting shutdown, transferring unnecessary pain and inflicting damage. And you see this in the polls, 71 percent of Americans say this wall is not worth this shutdown. This is hurting the country. But I think, you know, what's interesting to me, it's hurting President Trump.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, if it's not working --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Then you should be thrilled.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'm not thrilled. I'm kind of sad our country is in this place.

utterances.speaker: JEDEDIAH BILA, HOST
utterances.utterance: If all that stuff is happening though that you just laid out, why don't Democrats just get on board and support all the stuff that they supported years ago that he's proposing? I mean, they're all are on record as having supported not only the border security measures, but now they're having to say no, to no we don't want humanitarian aid. No, we don't want relief for TPS and DACA recipients just because Trump proposed it? I mean, I agree that having all these things stagnant is bad. But what he put forward was something that was completely palatable. And, you know, I think Nancy Pelosi, she's a spiteful one sometimes. She is and -- she is. And she didn't want Trump to come out. I don't love the State of the Union. I agree with Greg. I think it's boring. I think they somehow make presidents to -- for some reason, look like monarchs in that moment. It's painful to watch. But it is an opportunity to get out there and have a lot of people tune in to something who typically wouldn't tune in. And I don't think she wanted President Trump talking about the aspects of crime and the fact that he put forth something that had the DACA relief, that had the TPS relief so that voters in the middle could say, wait a minute, he did put something forth that could have been palatable, as why isn't she biting?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Let me just say --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But the thing is he gave a primetime address laying out all those things except for the stuff that he offered on Saturday.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And it didn't move the needle at all.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: But I think --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Against her.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So, I think -- if she's just being politically smart -- I mean, I'm not saying that it's like good policy. You know, being politically smart like why would you move?

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: That's true. But I know a lot of people that tune in -- like, I watch news all the time. We watch news all the time. But I know a lot of people that don't watch news a lot.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. That's true.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: But when it says, State of the Union, they will tune in --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's on every single channel.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They have no choice. It's on every channel. It's disgusting.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You could read a book if you want. But I think a lot of people --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I actually do read books, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I will say this to you that when you see this argument about crime and the wall the president was tweeting about today, it is so fallacious. I mean, the statistics say that crime, in fact, violent crime has been down over the last 20 years, even as we see the increase in illegal immigrant.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Why have Democrats been calling it a humanitarian crisis, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: When they didn't have a wall in El Paso, there was a lot of violent crime. They put the wall up and the crime dropped. Let's listen to what Chuck had to say about this whole hostage taking scenario.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Or not.

utterances.speaker: SEN. CHUCK SCHUMER, D-N.Y., SENATE MINORITY LEADER
utterances.utterance: The president's proposal is just wrapping paper on the same partisan package and hostage taking taxes. Hostage taking should not work. It's very hard to negotiate when a gun is held to your head. The American people know that President Trump is responsible for the shutdown, and now they have learned that Leader McConnell is a co- conspirator.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. And the president actually called Chuck Schumer a puppet of Pelosi. So it looks like he's trying to drive a wedge between the two leaders.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: To use his analogy, though, we have been -- Americans have been held hostage by career politicians who make a nice living off this prison of two ideas. They need us to be polarized on immigration. They need you to think that having a wall means you don't like people from Mexico. They need that argument because that keeps them in power. There has to be a way of breaking out of this prison because you can't be pro-refugee, but also, I think, maybe you should limit -- you should limit merit based immigration. I'm actually more inclined to go with refugees then merit-based because refugees are more grateful. So -- but you can actually have a compromise. Get out of this prison. When refugees come here, they make great citizens, but you have to extreme vet. See, the compromise here is having a number of tools in that shed. It's not just this or this. That's the prison. You've got to find all these other tools.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: A lot of different clubs in the bag.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I must say, it sounds like you're a Democrat, because that's what the Democrats are saying, we can have --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Don't you dare.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're right. We are the Democrats. You're absolutely right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: In fact, the Democrats --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Why aren't the Democrats coming forward?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: They have come forward. But, guess what, McConnell won't bring that -- to forward. Now he's going to have two votes tomorrow --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He won't bring it forward because the president won't sign it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, that's -- exactly.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, I'm glad you feel sorry for the president, Juan. You're compassionate.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Thank you. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The Kentucky high school student at the center of the video controversy is speaking out. Hear from him, up next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: NBC's Savannah Guthrie interviewed Nick Sandmann, the reluctant face of the Covington controversy. First up, some people.

utterances.speaker: SAVANNAH GUTHRIE, NBC HOST
utterances.utterance: Some people see is a young kid with a smirk on his face.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There's that some people again. One day I'd like to meet some people, some say it's Savannah Guthrie. Then came Nathan Phillips claim of a build the wall chant that apparently no one else heard.

utterances.speaker: GUTHRIE
utterances.utterance: Did anyone say build the wall?

utterances.speaker: NICK SANDMANN, COVINGTON STUDENT
utterances.utterance: I never -- anyone say build a wall. And I don't think I've seen it in any videos.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: After a review of the video, NBC News could not hear anyone shouting that hot button phrase.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So no one chanted it, but what if they did? Some say we're letting liberal fascist decide what can't be said in public. The black Israelites said things that we can't repeat here. But it's build the wall that matters most. It's a hot-button issue, some say, which is media for let's trash you. Then came the hat.

utterances.speaker: GUTHRIE
utterances.utterance: Do you think if you weren't wearing that hat, this might not have happened or it might have been different?

utterances.speaker: SANDMANN
utterances.utterance: That's possible, but I would have to assume what Mr. Phillips was thinking, and rather let him speak for why he came up to us.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Sound familiar? You go out wearing that, clearly you're asking for it because you're just a victim of your own choices and actions.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: You neglected they were mainly victims of their own choices and actions. Shouldn't we discuss that? Wonder if the hats had anything to do with your muted response.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Imagine saying that about a feminist protester and her clothes. Funny how the media who claimed their speech is always under threat because of Trump are now dictating what words and clothing are forbidden. Then they blame the victim. Hell, now standing is even hateful.

utterances.speaker: GUTHRIE
utterances.utterance: There's something aggressive about standing there, standing your ground. You both stood your ground. And it was like a stare down. What do you think of that now when you think about that moment?

utterances.speaker: SANDMANN
utterances.utterance: I would say Mr. Phillips has his right to come up to me. I had my right to stay there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't know. Maybe standing is the only thing to do when a stranger beats his drum in your face, but then Guthrie questioned whether teens would be scared of male adult strangers aggressively taunting them.

utterances.speaker: GUTHRIE
utterances.utterance: Did you feel threatened at all?

utterances.speaker: SANDMANN
utterances.utterance: I definitely felt threatened.

utterances.speaker: GUTHRIE
utterances.utterance: There were more of you than them, but you felt like they were stronger?

utterances.speaker: SANDMANN
utterances.utterance: They were a group of adults and I wasn't sure what was going to happen next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: OK. So get this, when a teen is standing quietly, somehow that's threatening, but when four crackpots threaten you, that's just good-natured fun. Meanwhile, the Washington Post whines that the right has seized on their screw up. So after pushing this smear, they're now blaming others for getting caught. Some might say the outcry prevented the press from doing far worse. So watching the media analyze this mess, I feel like I'm watching a murderer doing an autopsy on his own victim. It must be suicide, they declare. Well, some say they suck. All right, Jesse, so we've heard from the kid. Isn't it time that we see Nathan up there answering some questions?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, I think Nathan needs to go, get this savannah treatment. But, this is the thing, he won't be able to answer her questions. I just did a little investigation because the media won't, and Nathan Phillips, fresh off of this confrontation with the student, disrupted and attempted to disrupt the mass at D.C.'s National Shrine. He tried with a bunch of people, 20 of them, to go bang drums, invade the National Shrine during mass on this day, and they had to have security block him and locked the doors as he attempted to gain entry. It's also come to our attention this guy never served in Vietnam. He was a marine, but a lot of reports are saying he went AWOL four times and actually had to be put in the brig. But, he's on video saying when he returned from Vietnam he was called a baby killer and spit on. You never went to Vietnam. So, Phillips also gave an interview and no one has even talked about this. He was talking about what he was thinking. This guy, Phillips, said these white students were in the process of attacking the black individuals, didn't happen. They were, quote, "beasts preying on the black individuals." And he called the students racist. And he said the looks on the kids' faces were similar to the faces during lynching in the south. Now, this guy's story changed seven times. The fact that the media believed this guy without checking anything, what else is the media being told and just running with? How do we know?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It fits their assumptions. I mean, the thing is -- what kills me, Jed, is the -- say -- the idea, like if you're wearing something, you had it coming. We've learned that that's not what you say to people.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Yeah, the nerve to say that to a kid, too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah. You, obviously -- wearing a hat.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: -- you're wearing a skirt like that, you deserve it. I mean, it's crazy. And they're counting on -- so you just did that research, but they're counting on no one doing that, or you do it but it doesn't get -- doesn't get sent out. All they need is that initial clip and the judgments to be made. Now imagine if you went out and you were at -- on a march and you had -- you were a kid and you had a bunch of adults screaming at you, shouting horrific things, I give -- I'm still trying to figure out what this kid did wrong. I see he smirked. I see that. I see -- maybe he was confused. He didn't know what was going on. He didn't assault anybody. He didn't even shout back. How many people can say that, as a teenager, their first instinct wouldn't have been to say something back? To say, no, you're this. They didn't even do that. These kids were on their best behavior, frankly, given what was going on if you the before and after. And I can't believe that we're still talking about a smirk from a kid because he had a MAGA hat on. If he didn't have a MAGA hat and that was not a pro-life protest, this would not be a story.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, it wouldn't. And, you know, Dana, the lesson I learned, I'm never, ever looking at a viral video again, again, because it is actually so funny that it's called viral because it's contagious, pernicious, and --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It makes you sick.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It makes you sick, yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It does make you sick. The other thing is, remember back in the day before the internet --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The early '50s?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: This would not have been a national story or international story at all. It would have been a local D.C. story. Maybe on the national -- maybe on the national news, but unlikely to have ever gone beyond that. And so now these kids are having to go on The Today Show, which is quite intimidating. Not that Savanna is intimidating. But, look, you're basically on your own there in a room. You're 17 years old, 15 years -- however old he is. And what I read was that the left and the right was mad at Savannah Guthrie after this interview. I'm not sure why the left would be mad?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, I don't know. I have to say, Juan, I wouldn't have performed as well as that kid did in an event like that. That's like his first time on TV, I think.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I don't know. His facial expression was frozen. He looked like he's terrified. I don't know. Now, clearly, they hired a P.R. firm --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- to represent --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: How dare they. I know.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I just got to say to you guys, I don't understand how you made this young man into some, you know, victim here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He's clearly not a victim.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What you're saying is let's blame the media. And you and I agreed yesterday, by the way, that social media platform that spread this - -

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We don't even know who they are, where they're from --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We know who the Washington Post is --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no, hang on. And they have intentionally pushed out polarizing type videos intended to --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But the people who push them are always liberal media --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Hang on. Let me finish.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm letting you finish, Juan. Relax. Relax. Control. Control. Breathe in, Juan. Breathe in.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: If the mainstream media had ignore this story -- and I think Dana's right. I don't think the local section of the Washington Post would have covered this story

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But if the mainstream media had ignore the fact that the right and left picked up on this --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The left.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- then they would say, oh, my gosh, why is the mainstream media ignoring this big story? But, in fact, let me tell you, tomorrow night I'm going to go watch a basketball game, tomorrow night. The black Israelites will be standing there and they'll be saying rude things to me and my wife. They say to everybody.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But you had it coming, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: People -- thank you. People don't stand there and engage, and then --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's the first time they ever saw them.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They were waiting for the bus to go home.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Let me just say --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Those kids staying there, and you said -- he says, oh, well, I'm just standing there. No, he's staring down that Native American guy --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The guy got in his face, Juan. What do you want to do?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: He walks over --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You've got four or five black Israelites. You've got two busloads of these kids, and suddenly, oh, they're feeling so threatened. You know --

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: You have adults and children. Adults and children.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: This is ridiculous --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We've got to wrap this up

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- you've talked about things like black face at basketball games. If you want to bring up --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, you want to talk about that? We can talk about what that means in another block. They have these events where they go black, they go white, they go different colors. So it's a racial thing. OK, we'll go and look into that, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Anti-Trump critic and potential 2020 hopeful, John Kerry, taking a new shot at the president. His latest dig, ahead.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. Former Secretary of State John Kerry once again not hiding his disdain for President Trump. Here's Kerry at the world economic forum.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Final word then, Secretary Kerry, if you had President Trump sitting right opposite of you, what would your message be?

utterances.speaker: JOHN KERRY, FORMER U.S. SECRETARY OF STATE
utterances.utterance: I can't play that. I just did -- I would -- but I know that -- you see because he doesn't take any of this seriously. He doesn't have an ability to have that kind of conversation.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: What would you say to him to get it through? What would the message be?

utterances.speaker: KERRY
utterances.utterance: Resign.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Kerry hasn't officially ruled out a presidential run to potentially challenge Trump in 2020. Jedediah, what do you think? Is that somehow offensive or wrong for him to say that?

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: I don't know how Trump is going to handle that. He will have to figure out a way to pick up the pieces and carry-on. I mean, Kerry is so unlikable. I can't imagine that he would want to do this again. He doesn't get received well. His record is not great. And then he talks about the other part about it is that he talks about climate change and he's like, we're all going to die, the doom and gloom, the brink of disaster. I don't like when people of an opposing party sees an opportunity where there's a sitting president and they ask you a question like this, I don't like when you immediately go for the laugh or go for the -- that's what it seems like to me. It seems like he went for that moment where he could be applauded for saying something unkind about a sitting president. I don't like when people on the right do that either, instinctually, when they're asked a question like that. There's politician who may reenter the field. He's not a commentator. He may run again. I just think it makes him look bad. Wasn't a good moment for him, in my opinion?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Jesse, what do you make of this? One of the criticisms that Kerry has said previously is that he thinks this is a chaotic and corrupt administration, very critical of the Paris deal, the climate change deal being undone. The president pulling -- announcing the pullout from Syria. That's more substance, but you saw this and what did you make of it?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, you called Kerry unlikable, so that's not sexist, right? OK, I'm just trying to clarify. You can call a man unlikable, but you can't call a woman unlikable.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Well, Hillary's unlikeable, too. I'll say that, too.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I just want to make sure I know the rules before we get into this.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Why are you picking on her?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, no, I'm just -- I'm just trying to clarify, because you know, it seems like there's a double standard. I think you're right. I think he was trying to go for a laugh, and it took him 15 seconds to get the joke out. I think he's bitter, because Trump destroyed his legacy on Iran and on Paris. But these guys are so opposite, these two, if you think about it. I mean, John Kerry, you know, Mary's billionaires. Trump is the billionaire. He - - John Kerry was against the Iraq war before he was for it. Trump's always been against it. They just don't really see eye to eye on anything. And I just found out that John Kerry served in Vietnam. Did you know that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, he's also a Vietnam veteran. So that's very nice, because I just hadn't heard that before.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Really? Oh, because --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Are you going to continue your comparison?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Thank you for your service.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I was waiting for that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Are you going to continue your comparison?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Would you like to see Trump with a machine gun? I don't think that's a good idea for anyone.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes, he has bone spurs. But what we have, though, Dana, is a situation where you have a new book coming out next week by a Trump aide that says, "Oh, there is chaos and corruption in the administration." You have Chris Christie has got a book coming out next week, I think. He says, you know, he would have been in the administration, except Jared is mad, because he prosecuted his father and the like. So is John Kerry off when he says there's chaos and corruption?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, look, I think if he -- when he -- if you play the clip back, his instinct was not to say anything negative.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's what I thought.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's why it took 15 seconds to get to the laugh.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Because his instinct was to be polite and to support his country and his president. And I think that that's -- because he's been a public servant most of his life. And he's fresh off of a book tour. He has a Type A personality. He needs to keep busy. You look at somebody like Mitt Romney, who runs for president and loses and decides he's going to run for Senate from Utah. So don't sleep on John Kerry running for president. If you come up just short, you still think that you could make it. Like, 60,000 votes in Ohio, and it could've been his. So I think it could happen.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What do you think of it, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He makes Lurch look loose. But I agree with you. He didn't want to say anything. He was basically, in his head, it was like, "Why can you just ask me about climate change?"

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I flew all the way here in a private jet to talk climate, not Trump. And this is -- the applause tells you a lot. I think the applause is the bigger story. So here you have an extremely wealthy audience, who are threatened by Brexit, the Yellow Jackets of France, and Trump. All these things are of a same piece that scares the crap out of these people. And these are people who hired tons of private jets, or their own private jets, creating a massive carbon footprint to come here to talk about climate change. And when you ask them about that, what do they say, "Well, we purchased carbon offsets that offsets our jets." So what they're saying is "We're rich enough to fly private and pay the indulgences."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's elitist. And they are terrified right now, because they're watching the world change, Juan. The world is changing. You're looking at the Yellow Jackets, Brexit and Trump; you look at Brazil; you look at what might happen in Venezuela. Their days are numbered.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Putin's getting tired of winning.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And I think Martha MacCallum asks Secretary of State Mike Pompeo about the Kerry comment tonight on "The Story." I'm on that show, too, tonight.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, forget Pompeo. I'm going to watch for Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Saints fans now suing the NFL. Find out why. This is really interesting. Next on "The Five"

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Two furious Saints fans are now suing the NFL over a blown pass interference call that cost their team a trip to the Super Bowl. The season-ticket holders asking a judge to reverse the results of the NFC championship game or schedule a do-over. One Saints fan even going so far as to pay for billboards in Super Bowl city Atlanta, blasting the league, saying they blew it.

utterances.speaker: GRAPHIC
utterances.utterance: BILLBOARD THAT SAYS "NFL BLEAUX IT!"

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: All right, Greg, now I know we're litigious --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They spelled "blew" wrong. Did you notice that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I saw that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's B-L-E-W. How -- see? That's misspelled. I think they should be embarrassed. Anyway, I like to call that stuff out on Twitter, too.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Nice. Well done. Nicely done.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. So what were you going to ask me before I --?

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: No, I'm just saying we're litigious. I know we're a litigious society, but now you're suing over a sports result?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I -- I am with them for a couple of reasons.

utterances.speaker: I'll tell you one thing
utterances.utterance: If they have to replay the game, what's that going to do to Vegas? Like, what about all the sports books? Because the whole thing is they have -- they should play the game where that -- where that bad call was. They should start and play the game there. That's what they should do.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: From there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: From there. But then how are they going to do that with all the gambling from Vegas? But this -- the reason why I really like this is because L.A. doesn't even care that their team won. L.A. doesn't even know that the Rams are there. They're too busy doing other -- the Oscars; they've got the Lakers. They've got the Dodgers.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They have a teachers' strike.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They have, too -- they don't even care about the Rams. So make them care about the Rams. This will give the Rams some attention. And then L.A. will go, "Oh, that's right. We have a team in the Super Bowl." Or maybe not.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: They're doing better than the Chargers in terms of attendance.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Are the Chargers also in L.A.?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: See, I didn't even know that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Have you seen the video of when they're in the bar --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- all the Rams fans? And then they make it to the Super Bowl, and everyone's, like, "Hey, all right."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No one's cheering.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I agree with you. I remember back -- you remember that situation with George Brett and the pine tar and the New York Yankees?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And they said, "Well, we made the wrong call. We'll start the game from that point."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So while the betters in Vegas might be upset, imagine the TV ratings for a game that was now started again for five minutes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's exactly the reason we should do it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: TV ratings.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: You guys are all saying that they should redo this? I'm outraged.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, I'm not. I'm not.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The Saints were cheated. The Saints were cheated. There's no question the Saints got cheated.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Don't you feel like it sets a crazy precedent? People could be saying -- you watch "American Idol" --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It was a big screw-up.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: -- you don't like the person who wins, suddenly a lawsuit.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a big screw-up. No, this is --

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Are you crazy?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: This is what it is. This is -- lawyers and sore losers are ruining this country.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It all started with Gore-Lieberman. Remember, Sore-Loserman? They lost that recount, and they sued. I bet these Saints fans are Democrats, you know? They don't want the game to go the way they thought it was going to go, so they're going to sue. This is the way people do these things now.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I bet they're the biggest fans.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I like the good old days. When -- when the ref blew a call, you thought they were fixing the game for the mob.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Those were the good old days.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The good old days.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Now everybody sues.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes? Wow.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: He has power, the commissioner. He actually has the power to do this.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: He can -- he can say -- it's an actual real thing.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: He can say, "Redo the game."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, since we're breaking norms, left and right, there's no State of the Union.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We should play this game on Tuesday night.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This may -- that's a great idea!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's a good idea.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Instead of the State of the Union.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We could all be here doing color commentary.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's -- and this is the best idea I think I've ever had.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: And now you have -- OK, so this sets the pattern. This has been brought to court before. This isn't the first time this has happened. And you have them coming out and saying that -- wait, what was the ruling? I was looking for the ruling. "We're not obligated to please you." In other words, just because you buy a ticket and you go sit at a game --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: -- they're saying, "Well, you now, you're obligated to do this right. You're obligated" -- and they're saying no.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, then the Browns fans could sue for every season. They're never entertained ever.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Basically, if you did this, there would be no end.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Every single show. I mean, I watch all those --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, but this is such a -- this is such a glaring -- this is a glaring error. Everybody knows this is wrong. I mean, when you look at the play, it's like --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, so you know, now they have replay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: In so many sports, right? I mean, imagine if we had replay on "The Five." Jesse, oh, my God. You'd be out of here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We tried to do that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'd be out of here?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No. Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, I'm sorry to say --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I think Greg have to take a breath. You'd just have to calm him down, calm him down. We'd give him some time. But they have replay in every sport, Jedediah.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The problem is -- and I am an old-timer on this. I think refs are human. They make mistakes. That's part of the game. But in this case --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Or they're fixing it for the mob, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, the mob. I forgot, I forgot. That's a good point.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Your point is right, though. What if -- what if --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The mob.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: -- if the refs come out and say that they made a mistake, if there's an acknowledgement that it's -- that the call is wrong, then maybe you can have --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, they did. And in fact --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's what they did.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: -- be justified.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: They did, they did.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: That's what I'm saying. So in a case like this, maybe it's more justified if they don't acknowledge it. I just think everybody sounds like a bunch of babies. You don't like the end, so you cry and sue? That's terrible. What's wrong with people?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Just to piss off L.A., I want to do it. All right? They don't even know they have a team in the Super Bowl.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What if we refereed the game?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: "The Five" of us.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I like stripes.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: They're all crazy. It's litigious. It's litigious, I'm telling you. All right, stay right there. "Wild Card Wednesday" is coming up next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's time now for "Wild Card Wednesday." I've got the hat right here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yay.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I've got the hat. All right. Each of us chose a topic, and we put them in this hat. None of us knows the others' stories. OK. Selfie dysmorphia is driving people to seek surgery.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: This is yours?

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: That's mine.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK. Selfie dysmorphia has become the term to describe people, they seek plastic surgery, because they want to approve their appearance on Snapchat.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Right, but they use pictures of themselves. So what's happening is that you used to look at pictures of other people. Now, because there's so many filters and so many -- they're airbrushing pictures of themselves and using photos and going to the doctor and saying, "I want to look more like I do in this filtered, weird, crazy image."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, no.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Which is crazy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's -- that's too bad. When is it going to stop?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm the opposite. I noticed that I am too good-looking, and I'm getting plastic surgery make myself less attractive.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You want to be more unattractive.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I'm less -- I want to be more -- less --

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: To be more relatable.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
